result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Atkinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: - includes cover letter and revocation summary

Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in custody.    Steven M  Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:23
Michlig/Bayne Allison/Defendant /Court statement to sentencing
Court sentences to 76 ays jail - with credit for 76 days - Time served - unpaid costs reduced to judgment 
Appeal rights given -
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-18-2016 11:00 am

8:37 a.m. Defendant Adam J. Atkinson not in court. Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison appears in court. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atkinson is currently in the Vilas County Jail, not transported. Counsel to get new date from JA.
- includes cover letter - NOTE:  There was no revocation summary attached as referenced in cover letter.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-16-2016 08:30 am

2:49 p.m. Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Hogan enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing.
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 9 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision fees
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution - $39.42 (includes 10%)
Apology letter to Walmart 
Community Service - 50 hours
No entry upon any Walmart premises
Early termination of probation (6 months) if successful completion of Restorative Justice Program within first six months of probation and all other conditions of probation.
Special disposition under Section 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs.
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:03 p.m.

2:58 pm. Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Steve Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan states proposal has been made by State - Defendant has "life issues" he is dealing with - request adjournment.  No objection from state. Bail continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 2:59 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:05 pm - Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

01:38 pm - Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear 7-6-15 for AIA.  BR II Case.  Court questions defendant as to missed appearance.  Defendant states fine paid and thought that took care of this case.  Court reinstates sig bond.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
03:17 pm - Defendant Adam J. Atkinson not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests and Court authorizes warrant.
may not be on any Walmart premises - Submit to Booking within 24 hours

02:17 pm - Defendant Adam J. Atkinson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant understands options for obtaining counsel,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
